channel.title: Converting .bat to .sh
channel.description:
Hey guys, I recently bought a vps on vpsland.com, but it was a linux Ive managed to added a few things, but i cant find out how to convert my run.bat to a .sh file Do any of you guys know how to do this?? This is my run.bat:
@echo off title Disturbed 704 echo starting... "C:/Program Files/Java/jre7/bin/java.exe" -Xmx10240m -cp bin;lib/*; com.rs.Launcher true true false pause
Kind regards, Kon

item.title: Converting .bat to .sh
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

Also since Linux isnâ€™t shit you can just type java instead of all that C:\//DOCUMENTSANDSETTINGS bullshit

Read full topic

item.title: Converting .bat to .sh
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

You have 10 GBs to allocate to your rsps? Lol. Try reading this article. Then you will realise all you need to do is, a) get rid of everything but line #4 and b) change the file-path to a unix-friendly one.

Read full topic

item.title: Converting .bat to .sh
item.dc:creator: @Kon Kon
item.description:
@Kon wrote:

Hey guys,

I recently bought a vps on vpsland.com, but it was a linux
Ive managed to added a few things, but i cant find out how to convert my run.bat to a .sh file
Do any of you guys know how to do this??

This is my run.bat:

@echo off title Disturbed 704 echo starting... "C:/Program Files/Java/jre7/bin/java.exe" -Xmx10240m -cp bin;lib/*; com.rs.Launcher true true false pause

Kind regards,

Kon
